posts.name: Cole Wilson
posts.cooked: Hello! Our team is using PathPlanner with a navX gyro. PathPlanner is working very well for us and we have no real issues with the actual auton. However, when the robot switches to teleop after a red auton, the field-centric controls for swerve (joystick forward goes downfield) are reversed like the gyro was reset to be on blue side. When we start on blue it works just as expected, and we see this issue both at practice and on actual FMS . We can fix this pretty quickly by manually rotating the robot and manually hitting our reset gyro button, but this still takes time and I know there is a better way. Any thoughts? Our team’s current code is at GitHub - cole-wilson/Robot24: Olympia Robotics Federation (FRC 4450) 2024 Robot Control Program . I apologize for the lack of various comments in it. Thanks in advance!

link_counts.title: GitHub - cole-wilson/Robot24: Olympia Robotics Federation (FRC 4450) 2024 Robot Control Program

posts.name: Cole Wilson
posts.cooked: I’ll also point out that it’s possible that we are somehow doing something else to mess up the gyro and it might not be PathPlanner, but this issue only presents itself after a red auton so I thought I’d ask.

posts.name: slickvic2252
posts.cooked: To start off im not a programmer but i onow what is happening. Pathplanner always has 0,0 on blue side of the field and when you switch to a red side auto the x,y points just get traslated to where they need to be on red vs on blue but your robot still thinks that 0,0 is blue so your heading never changes. To fix this issue the easiest way is to just invert your drive joystick when on red alliance.

posts.name: Cole Wilson
posts.cooked: Hmm, that might be it but shouldn’t the gyro not get changed? When we turn on robot it reads 0 deg no matter what side it’s on (which is intended, teleop works fine on either side if we don’t run an auton). We can’t merely invert the joystick because we use the gyro for other automated procedures during teleop. EDIT: clarity

posts.name: Cole Wilson
posts.cooked: @slickvic2252 actually you are correct: I figured out the issue. We were inadvertently “zeroing” our gyro to the provided pathplanner gyro value, but this was 180deg on red.
We are also having this issue. How were you able to resolve it? Is it the resetOdometry method passed into AutoBuilder that does this?

posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked: Just invert the x and y joystick values when you are on the red alliance. Don’t invert your rotational though as it remains unchanged
